member.name: Region.Clone
member.summary: The Region.Clone method makes a copy of thisRegion object and returns the address of the newRegion object.
member.returns: This method returns a pointer to the newRegion object.

member.name: Region.Complement
member.summary: The Region.Complement method updates this region to the portion of the specified path's interior that does not intersect this region.
member.param: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object that specifies the path to use to update thisRegion object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns , which is an element of the Status enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Complement
member.summary: The Region.Complement method updates this region to the portion of the specified rectangle's interior that does not intersect this region.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update thisRegion object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns , which is an element of the Status enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Complement
member.summary: The Region.Complement method updates this region to the portion of the specified rectangle's interior that does not intersect this region.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update this Region object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Complement
member.summary: The Region.Complement method updates this region to the portion of another region that does not intersect this region.
member.param: Pointer to aRegion object to use to update thisRegion object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Equals
member.summary: The Region.Equals method determines whether this region is equal to a specified region.
member.param: Pointer to aRegion object to test against thisRegion object.
Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the region that is specified by theregion parameter.
member.returns: If this region is identical to the specified region, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.Exclude
member.summary: The Region.Exclude method updates this region to the portion of itself that does not intersect the specified path's interior.
member.param: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object that specifies the path to use to update thisRegion object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns , which is an element of the Status enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Exclude
member.summary: The Region.Exclude method updates this region to the portion of itself that does not intersect the specified rectangle's interior.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update thisRegion object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Exclude
member.summary: The Region.Exclude method updates this region to the portion of itself that does not intersect the specified rectangle's interior.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update this Region object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Exclude
member.summary: The Region.Exclude method updates this region to the portion of itself that does not intersect another region.
member.param: Pointer to aRegion object to use to update thisRegion object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns , which is an element of theStatus enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.FromHRGN
member.summary: The Region.FromHRGN method creates a Windows GDI+Region object from a Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) region.
member.param: Handle to an existing GDI region.
member.returns: This method returns a pointer to the newRegion object.

member.name: Region.GetBounds
member.summary: The Region.GetBounds method gets a rectangle that encloses this region.
member.param: Pointer to aRectF object that receives the enclosing rectangle.
Pointer to aGraphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the rectangle.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns , which is an element of theStatus enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.GetBounds
member.summary: The Region.GetBounds method gets a rectangle that encloses this region.
member.param: Pointer to a Rect object that receives the enclosing rectangle.
Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the rectangle.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.GetData
member.summary: The Region.GetData method gets data that describes this region.
member.param: Pointer to an array ofBYTE values that receives the region data.

Integer that specifies the size, in bytes, of thebuffer array. The size of thebuffer array can be greater than or equal to the number of bytes required to store the region data. The exact number of bytes required can be determined by calling the method.
Optional. Pointer to anINT that receives the number of bytes of data actually received by thebuffer array. The default value is NULL.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns , which is an element of theStatus enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.GetDataSize
member.summary: The Region.GetDataSize method gets the number of bytes of data that describes this region.
member.returns: This method returns the number of bytes of region data.

member.name: Region.GetHRGN
member.summary: The Region.GetHRGN method creates a Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) region from this region.
member.param: Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region.
member.returns: This method returns a Windows handle to a GDI region that is created from this region.

member.name: Region.GetLastStatus
member.summary: The Region.GetLastStatus method returns a value that indicates the nature of thisRegion object's most recent method failure.

returns.para: The Region.GetLastStatus method returns an element of the enumeration.
If no methods invoked on thisRegion object have failed since the previous call to Region.GetLastStatus, then Region.GetLastStatus returns Ok.

If at least one method invoked on thisRegion object has failed since the previous call to Region.GetLastStatus, then Region.GetLastStatus returns a value that indicates the nature of the most recent failure.

member.name: Region.GetRegionScans
member.summary: The Region.GetRegionScans method gets an array of rectangles that approximate this region. The region is transformed by a specified matrix before the rectangles are calculated.
member.param: Pointer to a Matrix object that is used to transform the region.
Pointer to an array of RectF objects that receives the rectangles.
Pointer to an INT that receives a value that indicates the number of rectangles that approximate this region. The value is valid even if rects is a NULL pointer.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.GetRegionScans
member.summary: The Region.GetRegionScans method gets an array of rectangles that approximate this region. The region is transformed by a specified matrix before the rectangles are calculated.
member.param: Pointer to a Matrix object that is used to transform the region.
Pointer to an array of Rect objects that receives the rectangles.
Pointer to an INT that receives a value that indicates the number of rectangles that approximate this region. The value is valid even ifrects is a NULL pointer.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.GetRegionScansCount
member.summary: The Region.GetRegionScansCount method gets the number of rectangles that approximate this region. The region is transformed by a specified matrix before the rectangles are calculated.
member.param: Pointer to a matrix that is used to transform the region.
member.returns: This method returns an integer that indicates the number of rectangles that approximate this region.

member.name: Region.Intersect
member.summary: The Region.Intersect method updates this region to the portion of itself that intersects the specified path's interior.
member.param: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object that specifies the path to use to update this region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns , which is an element of the Status enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Intersect
member.summary: The Region.Intersect method updates this region to the portion of itself that intersects the specified rectangle's interior.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update thisRegion object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Intersect
member.summary: The Region.Intersect method updates this region to the portion of itself that intersects the specified rectangle's interior.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update this region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Intersect
member.summary: The Region.Intersect method updates this region to the portion of itself that intersects another region.
member.param: Pointer to aRegion object to use to update thisRegion object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.IsEmpty
member.summary: The Region.IsEmpty method determines whether this region is empty.
member.param: Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region.
member.returns: If this region is empty, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.IsInfinite
member.summary: The Region.IsInfinite method determines whether this region is infinite.
member.param: Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region.
member.returns: If this region is infinite, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.IsVisible
member.summary: The Region.IsVisible method determines whether a point is inside this region.
member.param: Reference to a point to test.
Optional. Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the point. The default value is NULL.
member.returns: If the point is inside this region, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.IsVisible
member.summary: The Region.IsVisible method determines whether a point is inside this region.
member.param: Reference to a point to test.
Optional. Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the point. The default value is NULL.
member.returns: If the point is inside this region, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.IsVisible
member.summary: The Region.IsVisible method determines whether a rectangle intersects this region.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to test.
Optional. Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the rectangle. The default value is NULL.
member.returns: If the rectangle intersects this region, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.IsVisible
member.summary: The Region.IsVisible method determines whether a rectangle intersects this region.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to test.
Optional. Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the rectangle. The default value is NULL.
member.returns: If the rectangle intersects this region, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.IsVisible
member.summary: The Region.IsVisible method determines whether a point is inside this region.
member.param: Integer that specifies the x-coordinate of the point to test.
Integer that specifies the y-coordinate of the point to test.
Optional. Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the point. The default value is NULL.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.IsVisible
member.summary: The Region.IsVisible method determines whether a rectangle intersects this region.
member.param: Integer that specifies the x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle to test.
Integer that specifies the y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle to test.
Integer that specifies the width of the rectangle to test.
Integer that specifies the height of the rectangle to test.
Optional. Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the rectangle. The default value is NULL.
member.returns: If the rectangle intersects this region, the method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.IsVisible
member.summary: The Region.IsVisible method determines whether a point is inside this region.
member.param: Real number that specifies the x-coordinate of the point to test.
Real number that specifies the y-coordinate of the point to test.
Optional. Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the point. The default value is NULL.
member.returns: If the point is inside this region, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.IsVisible
member.summary: The Region.IsVisible method determines whether a rectangle intersects this region.
member.param: Real number that specifies the x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle to test.
Real number that specifies the y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the rectangle to test.
Real number that specifies the width of the rectangle to test.
Real number that specifies the height of the rectangle to test.
Optional. Pointer to a Graphics object that contains the world and page transformations required to calculate the device coordinates of this region and the rectangle. The default value is NULL.
member.returns: If the rectangle intersects this region, this method returns TRUE; otherwise, it returns FALSE.

member.name: Region.MakeEmpty
member.summary: The Region.MakeEmpty method updates this region to an empty region. In other words, the region occupies no space on the display device.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns , which is an element of the Status enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.MakeInfinite
member.summary: The Region.MakeInfinite method updates this region to an infinite region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns , which is an element of the Status enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Region
member.summary: Creates a region that is defined by data obtained from another region.
member.param: Pointer to an array of bytes that specifies a region. The data contained in the bytes is obtained from another region by using the method.
Integer that specifies the number of bytes in theregionData array.

member.name: Region.Region
member.summary: Creates a region that is defined by a path (a GraphicsPath object) and has a fill mode that is contained in the GraphicsPath object.
member.param: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object that specifies the path.

member.name: Region.Region
member.summary: Creates a region that is defined by a rectangle.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle.

member.name: Region.Region
member.summary: Creates a region that is defined by a rectangle.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle.

member.name: Region.Region
member.summary: Creates a region that is infinite. This is the default constructor.
member.param: TBD

member.name: Region.Region
member.summary: Creates a region that is infinite. This is the default constructor.
member.param: TBD

member.name: Region.Region
member.summary: Creates a region that is identical to the region that is specified by a handle to a Windows Graphics Device Interface (GDI) region.
member.param: Handle to an existing GDI region.

member.name: Region.Region
member.summary: Creates a region that is infinite. This is the default constructor.

member.name: Region.Transform
member.summary: The Region.Transform method transforms this region by multiplying each of its data points by a specified matrix.
member.param: Pointer to a matrix that specifies the transformation.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Translate
member.summary: The Region.Translate method offsets this region by specified amounts in the horizontal and vertical directions.
member.param: Integer that specifies the amount to shift the region in the x direction.
Integer that specifies the amount to shift the region in the y direction.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Translate
member.summary: The Region.Translate method offsets this region by specified amounts in the horizontal and vertical directions.
member.param: Integer that specifies the amount to shift the region in the x direction.
Integer that specifies the amount to shift the region in the y direction.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Union
member.summary: The Region.Union method updates this region to all portions (intersecting and nonintersecting) of itself and all portions of the specified path's interior.
member.param: Pointer to a GraphicsPath object that specifies the path to use to update thisRegion object.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Union
member.summary: The Region.Union method updates this region to all portions (intersecting and nonintersecting) of itself and all portions of the specified rectangle's interior.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update this region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Union
member.summary: The Region.Union method updates this region to all portions (intersecting and nonintersecting) of itself and all portions of the specified rectangle's interior.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update this region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Union
member.summary: The Region.Union method updates this region to all portions (intersecting and nonintersecting) of itself and all portions of another region.
member.param: Pointer to aRegion object to use to update this region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Xor
member.summary: The Region.Xor method updates this region to the nonintersecting portions of itself and the specified path's interior.
member.param: Pointer to a GraphicsPath that specifies the path to use to update this region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Xor
member.summary: The Region.Xor method updates this region to the nonintersecting portions of itself and the specified rectangle's interior.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update this region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Xor
member.summary: The Region.Xor method updates this region to the nonintersecting portions of itself and the specified rectangle's interior.
member.param: Reference to a rectangle to use to update this region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.

member.name: Region.Xor
member.summary: The Region.Xor method updates this region to the nonintersecting portions of itself and another region.
member.param: Pointer to a region to use to update this region.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns Ok, which is an element of the enumeration.
If the method fails, it returns one of the other elements of the enumeration.
